definition: Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: There are large differences on linguistic properties of syntax between Chinese and some Indo-European languages like German.
sentences.chinese: 漢語與德語等印歐語言在句法特性上有很大差別。

sentences.english: Pyotr was a 1)precocious child, having learned to read French and German by the age of six.
sentences.chinese: 彼得是一個早熟的孩子，六歲時就能夠讀法語和德語。

sentences.english: Speak Italian, the local French-speaking and German.
sentences.chinese: 講意大利語，個別地區講法語和德語。

sentences.english: For this example, the cards are a set of German vocabulary words and phrases.
sentences.chinese: 對於這個示例，這些卡片是一組德語單詞和短語。

sentences.english: English is more widespread and more used in international intercourse than German.
sentences.chinese: 英語在國際交往中比德語使用得更爲廣泛。

sentences.english: He once heard the song sung in German.
sentences.chinese: 他曾聽人用德語唱過這支歌。

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs govern the accusative case in German.
sentences.chinese: 在德語中，許多及物動詞左右着賓格。

sentences.english: The latest German-language version of this standard will always be taken as authoritative.
sentences.chinese: 這份標準的最新德語版總是作爲權威文件。

sentences.english: Tom fagged (away) at German for two years.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆刻苦地學了兩年德語。

sentences.english: In the German-speaking areas, German is the lingua franca.
sentences.chinese: 在德語區內，通用的是德文與德語。

sentences.english: In the German-speaking areas, German is the lingua franca.
sentences.chinese: 在德語區內，通用的是德文與德語。

sentences.english: Very well, I begin to cipher out the German for that answer.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我開始搜腸刮肚嘗試用德語作答。

sentences.english: After a word of introduction I asked what I should speak, French or German.
sentences.chinese: 在作了介紹之後，我問他我是該說法語還是德語。

sentences.english: The candle burned threateningly, and the officers chatted in German.
Why is viola called BRATSCHE in Germany?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼德語裏中提琴叫“不拉車”？

definition: Korean language (esp. in context of South Korea)
